So in 93' this lil guy came to be.

My Life

As much as I hate the snow, I've lived in Wisconsin most of my life. My family moved here in 1998', and have been here since. Throughout my youth, Ive always been a creative. I even built my very first game while in a middle school summer program. It was so bad but worth it. This sparked my interest. Then, I proceeded to submit art frequently at school competitions. Always sketching something. Always carrying my sketchpad.


Once I started taking Graphic Design in High School, I knew I was going to have a career in conveying art with technology. I was fascinated. I even joined the Reserves to pay for art school in Chicago. That didn't happen, but along the way, I was introduced to the tech field as a Signal Support Operations Specialist. This allowed me to spend a few years soaking up what tactical communications can do and configuring systems that run them. It was fun, but to me, it wasnt always fulfilling.


I saw two issues before me. I stopped drawing and I wasn't really motivated in my job. I saw how rapidly developers were making a lifestyle by being creative and I wanted in! So while on deployment, I continued a full stack developer course I was taking prior to leaving and really hunkered down to learn how to build things. That was it. I finally felt like I could do build cool looking solutions, and make hella money doing it. Now, as I look to the future, I'm looking to grow a tech agency, sell my NFT art, and teach what I know to those getting started.

Career Goals
